Name: Hieroglyphic signs
Description: This limestone relief shows several excercises of hieroglyphic signs. We notice on the right, from  the  top down,  two reed shafts which indicate the "y" sign in ancient egyptian, a "neb"-basket and a reed shaft placed horizontally. On the left we find a representation of the upper part of an owl above a "neb"-basket. All the signs are of mediocre execution and hardly neat.
